newsitem.title: PERU: Peru's Backus shares jump on Lima bolsa.
newsitem.headline: Peru's Backus shares jump on Lima bolsa.

text.p: Shares of Union de Cervecerias Backus y Johnston SA on Wednesday were showing big gains on the Lima bolsa amid strong interest by pensions funds and financial groups in the brewery group's stock, brokers said.

By 12.25 p.m. local time (1725 GMT) -- less than an hour before the four-hour session's close -- Backus's share price climbed to 2.37 soles on strong volume of 1.4 million shares, the Lima Stock Exchange said.
"The Backus gain is because investors have realized the share price has lagged behind the market's upward trend," said Julio Alcalde of local brokerage MGS.
Investors also expect the merger of the Backus sister companies earlier in the year will result in more efficient management, he added.

The group merged Backus y Johnston, Compania Nacional de Cerveza, Cervecera de Trujillo SA and Cerveceria del Norte at the beginning of 1997. The shares began trading as a single stock at the beginning of May.
Overall, trading was heavy in Lima as mining stocks led a rally that pushed the General Index up 3.03 percent to 1,959.4 points by late session.
